question: Why did the youngest want to seek his fortune?
answer1: The youngest was not content at home.

question: Where did the youngest come to after wandering for a few days?
answer1: a giant's castle

question: What was the king's son to do while the giant was away?
answer1: clean the stable

question: What was the king's son not to do?
answer1: go into any of the rooms that lie behind the one in which he slept last night

question: Why did the king's son walk up and down the room?
answer1: He thought there would be plenty of time to clean the stable.

question: What was special about the first kettle?
answer1: It was boiling but the king's son could find no fire beneath it.
answer2: He dipped in a lock of his hair and at once the hair grew just like copper.

question: What was different about the second and third kettle?
answer1: The second kettle turned his hair into silver.
answer2: The third kettle turned his hair into gold.

question: How did the king's son feel about the kettles?
answer1: intrigued
answer2: surprised

question: Who was in the fourth room?
answer1: a maiden
answer2: a king's daughter

question: How did the maiden feel to see the king's son?
answer1: surprised
answer2: shocked

question: What would happen if the king's son does as the others have done, according to the maiden?
answer1: For every shovelful he pitched out, ten fresh shovelfuls would fly in.

question: How did the maiden tell the king's son to go about it?
answer1: turn around the shovel, and work with the handle

question: What did the king's son and maiden agree?
answer1: They would marry.

question: What happened when the king's son used the shovel as he had seen his father's grooms use it?
answer1: He had to stop quickly, for after he had worked a little while, he hardly had room to stand.

question: What made the stable become clean in a wink?
answer1: The king's son turned the shovel around and used the handle.

question: Why did the giant think the king's son had spoken to the Master Girl?
answer1: The king's son could not have cleaned the stable alone.

question: Why did the king's son pretend to not know of the Master Girl?
answer1: He did not want the giant to know they had spoken.
answer2: He did not want the giant to know he had gone into the other rooms.

question: What did the giant do the next morning?
answer1: went off again with his goats

question: What was special about the giant's horse?
answer1: It was not an easy matter to ride this horse home.
answer2: He would come running up, breathing fire and flame.

question: Why did the king's son think fetching the horse would be easy?
answer1: He had ridden swift horses before.

question: How was the king's son able to fetch the horse?
answer1: seized the moment when he came running up to him with his jaws wide open, and threw the bit into his mouth

question: What happened after the bit was thrown into the horse's mouth?
answer1: He stood still, as gentle as a young lamb, and the king's son had no trouble bringing him to the stable.

question: How did the giant feel about the king's son ability to bring the horse in on his own?
answer1: skeptical
answer2: doubtful

question: What would the king's son be allowed to do once he fetched the giant's tribute?
answer1: rest of the remainder of the time

question: Why did the giant think he was a kind master?
answer1: The giant gave seemingly simple tasks.
answer2: The giant gave tasks that seem easy but were actually tricky.

question: Why did the king's son go to the Master Girl?
answer1: He did not know how much to ask for.
answer2: He had never been to the devil's place.

question: What must the king's son do with the club?
answer1: strike the rock with it

question: How much did the king's son ask for from the rock?
answer1: as much as he could carry

question: What did the king's son see when he went in?
answer1: a great deal of gold and silver lying in the hill

question: How will the giant feel when he finds out the king's son has spoken to the Master Girl?
answer1: angry
answer2: furious

question: Why did the Master Girl not slaughter the king's son like the giant told her to?
answer1: She did not want to kill him.
answer2: She wanted to trick the giant.

question: What did the giant do while the Master Girl was to make the soup?
answer1: slept

question: Why were the Master Girl and king's son able to leave the giant's castle?
answer1: The giant was asleep.
answer2: The giant didn't know they were leaving.

question: Why did the giant not realize that the Master Girl and king's son had escaped?
answer1: The giant thought the voice was the Master Girl.

question: How did the giant feel when he woke up and could not find the Master Girl?
answer1: confused
answer2: uncertain

question: What did the giant realize had come to pass when he saw a light?
answer1: The Master Girl and king's son had run away.
answer2: The Master Girl and king's son had tricked him.

question: What happened when the sea-sucker swallowed the water?
answer1: lowered the water so that the giant could see the king's son and Master Girl out on the ship

question: What did the hill-borer do?
answer1: bored a hole through the rock

question: What did the Master Girl and king's son do before the sea-sucker could take a single swallow?
answer1: landed

question: Why did the king's son want the Master Girl to wait until he fetched the seven horses?
answer1: He did not think going afoot fitting for either of them.

question: What did the Master Girl think the king's son would do when he returned home?
answer1: forget her

question: Why did the king's son think he would not forget the Master Girl?
answer1: They had passed through so many hardships together and they love each other so dearly.

question: What must the king's son do when people come to meet him?
answer1: act as though he did not see them

question: What was occurring when the king's son returned home?
answer1: One of his brothers was just getting married.

question: What did the people do because the king's son would not come into the castle?
answer1: came out with food and drink

question: What happened when the king's son took a bite of the apple?
answer1: He had forgotten the Master Girl and that he was to fetch her.

question: Who gave the king's son the apple?
answer1: the bride's sister

question: Who lived in the little hut?
answer1: an old woman
answer2: an arrant and evil witch

question: Why did the old woman agree to take in the Master Girl?
answer1: for love of money

question: What did the old woman not want the Master Girl to do?
answer1: clean up a bit

question: How did the old woman feel when the Master Girl began to clean?
answer1: angry

question: What did the old woman do when the gold flamed up?
answer1: ran out as though the evil one were after her

question: Why was the bailiff surprised by the golden hut?
answer1: It seemed out of place.
answer2: It was a random golden hut.

question: How did the bailiff feel when he finally let go of the poker?
answer1: frightened
answer2: terrified

question: What did the bailiff do once he let go of the poker?
answer1: ran like a madman

question: What happened once the clerk had the door-knob in his hand?
answer1: He was stuck.
answer2: The Master Girl made the doorknob stick to him.
answer3: The clerk had to dance the whole night.

question: What did the clerk do because he was in such a hurry to leave?
answer1: forgot his sacksful of money and his wish to marry

question: What did the Master Girl ask the magistrate to fetch?
answer1: the calf

question: What did the magistrate look like after his dance with the calf?
answer1: ragged and badly beaten

question: Who was to be marry on the following day?
answer1: the older prince
answer2: the one who had stayed with the giant

question: How did the bailiff know of the poker?
answer1: He had been stuck to it.
answer2: He had been to the maiden's place before.

question: What did the poker do?
answer1: kept the axle from breaking
answer2: fixed the axle

question: What happened every time the coach left the court-yard?
answer1: The bottom kept breaking.

question: Who else had been invited to the wedding besides the bailiff?
answer1: the clerk
answer2: the magistrate

question: What happened because the calf pulled the coach?
answer1: It moved from the spot quickly enough.
answer2: It flew over stick and stone, hill and dale, so that the people inside could hardly catch their breath.

question: Why did the king's son want to invite the Master Girl?
answer1: She had lent them the poker, and the door, and the calf.

question: How did the king's son feel when he recognized the Master Girl?
answer1: happy

question: Why did the king give the Master Girl a place at the head of the table?
answer1: She was more than she appeared to be.

question: Why was the witch punished?
answer1: She had tricked the king's son.
answer2: She had made the king's son forget the Master Girl.

question: How did the Master Girl feel to be reunited with the king's son?
answer1: happy
answer2: elated
